29 std::size_t write_data(void *ptr, std::size_t size, std::size_t nmemb, void *stream) {
30  std::string data((const char *) ptr, (std::size_t) size * nmemb);
31  *((std::stringstream *) stream) << data << std::endl;
32  return size * nmemb;
33 }
41 bool HTTPDownloader::download(const std::string &url,
42  std::string &output) {
43  curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_URL, url.c_str());
44  curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 5L); //wait for website response max 5s
45  std::stringstream out;
46  curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, 1L);
47  curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_NOSIGNAL, 1); //Prevent "longjmp causes uninitialized stack frame" bug
48  curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_ACCEPT_ENCODING, "deflate");
49  curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_WRITEDATA, &out);
50  curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, write_data);
51  CURLcode res = curl_easy_perform(curl);
52  output += out.str();
53  if (res != CURLE_OK) {
54  return false;
55  } else {
56  return true;
57  }
58 }

95 std::string HTTPDownloader::cleanhtml(const std::string &html) {
96  // init a tidy document
97  TidyDoc tidy_doc = tidyCreate();
98  TidyBuffer output_buffer = {0};
99 
100  // configure tidy
101  // the flags tell tidy to output xml and disable warnings
102  bool config_success = tidyOptSetBool(tidy_doc, TidyXmlOut, yes)
103  && tidyOptSetBool(tidy_doc, TidyQuiet, yes)
104  && tidyOptSetBool(tidy_doc, TidyNumEntities, yes)
105  && tidyOptSetBool(tidy_doc, TidyShowWarnings, no);
106 
107  int tidy_rescode = -1;
108 
109  // parse input
110  if (config_success)
111  tidy_rescode = tidyParseString(tidy_doc, html.c_str());
112  if (tidy_rescode >= 0)
113  tidy_rescode = tidyCleanAndRepair(tidy_doc);
114  if (tidy_rescode >= 0)
115  tidy_rescode = tidySaveBuffer(tidy_doc, &output_buffer);
116  if (tidy_rescode < 0)
117  throw ("Tidy error: " + tidy_rescode);
118 
119  std::string result = (char *) output_buffer.bp;
120  tidyBufFree(&output_buffer);
121  tidyRelease(tidy_doc);
122 
123  return result;
124 }

130 std::vector<std::string> HTTPDownloader::getLinesFromFile(std::string filename) {
131  std::vector<std::string> http_address; //stores html addresses
132  std::string line;
133  std::ifstream http_address_file(filename); //in every line should be other http address
134 
135  if (http_address_file.is_open()) {
136  while (!http_address_file.eof()) {
137  getline(http_address_file, line);
138  http_address.push_back(line);
139  }
140  http_address_file.close();
141  } else {
142  std::cout << "nie udalo sie otworzyc pliku" << std::endl;
143  }
144 
145  return http_address;
146 }
147 
156 void getNodeAndChildren(const xmlpp::Node *node, std::ostream &textFromBodyFile, unsigned int indentation,
157  std::set<std::string> &uniqueAttribs) {
158 
159  bool get_href_from_this_node = false;
160  const xmlpp::ContentNode *nodeContent = dynamic_cast<const xmlpp::ContentNode *>(node);
161  const xmlpp::TextNode *nodeText = dynamic_cast<const xmlpp::TextNode *>(node);
162  const xmlpp::CommentNode *nodeComment = dynamic_cast<const xmlpp::CommentNode *>(node);
163 
164  if (nodeText && nodeText->is_white_space()) //Let's ignore the indenting - you don't always want to do this.
165  return;
166 
167  Glib::ustring nodename = node->get_name();
168 
169  if (!nodeText && !nodeComment && !nodename.empty()) //Let's not say "name: text".
170  {
171  if (node->get_name() == "a") {
172  get_href_from_this_node = true;
173  }
174  }
175  //Treat the various node types differently:
176  try {
177  if (nodeText) {
178  textFromBodyFile << nodeText->get_content() << std::endl;
179  } else if (const xmlpp::Element *nodeElement = dynamic_cast<const xmlpp::Element *>(node)) {
180  const xmlpp::Element::AttributeList &attributes = nodeElement->get_attributes();
181  for (xmlpp::Element::AttributeList::const_iterator iter = attributes.begin();
182  iter != attributes.end(); ++iter) {
183  const xmlpp::Attribute *attribute = *iter;
184  if (get_href_from_this_node && attribute->get_name() == "href") {
185  std::string href(attribute->get_value());
186  std::string s = href.substr(0, 6); //we want /wiki/ here
187  if ((href.find(":") != std::string::npos) ||
188  s != "/wiki/") //if in href is ":" or there is no /wiki/ we don't want it
189  {
190  } else {
191  std::string dont_want_this("/wiki/");
192  std::string::size_type i = href.find(dont_want_this);
193 
194  if (i != std::string::npos)
195  href.erase(i, dont_want_this.length());
196  uniqueAttribs.insert(href);
197  }
198  get_href_from_this_node = false;
199  }
200  }
201  }
202  }
203  catch (Glib::ConvertError e) {
204  //std::cout << "Error ocured, but whatever" << std::endl;
205  }
206  if (!nodeContent) {
207  //Recurse through child nodes:
208  xmlpp::Node::NodeList list = node->get_children();
209  for (xmlpp::Node::NodeList::iterator iter = list.begin(); iter != list.end(); ++iter) {
210  getNodeAndChildren(*iter, textFromBodyFile, indentation + 2, uniqueAttribs); //recursive
211  }
212  }
213 }
214 
220 std::string printNodeAndChildren(const xmlpp::Node *node) {
221  //recursive function that prints to given ofstream (exp file) the text of give node from parsed xml file
222  const xmlpp::ContentNode *nodeContent = dynamic_cast<const xmlpp::ContentNode *>(node);
223  const xmlpp::TextNode *nodeText = dynamic_cast<const xmlpp::TextNode *>(node);
224 
225  std::string output;
226 
227  if (nodeText && nodeText->is_white_space()) //Let's ignore the indenting - you don't always want to do this.
228  return "";
229  if (nodeText) {
230  output += nodeText->get_content();
231  output += '\n';
232  }
233  if (!nodeContent) {
234  //Recurse through child nodes:
235  xmlpp::Node::NodeList list = node->get_children();
236  for (xmlpp::Node::NodeList::iterator iter = list.begin(); iter != list.end(); ++iter) {
237  output += printNodeAndChildren(*iter); //recursive
238  }
239  }
240  return output;
241 }
242 
248 void printNodeAndChildren(const xmlpp::Node *node, std::ofstream &textFromBodyFile) {
249 
250  //recursive function that prints to given ofstream (exp file) the text of give node from parsed xml file
251  const xmlpp::ContentNode *nodeContent = dynamic_cast<const xmlpp::ContentNode *>(node);
252  const xmlpp::TextNode *nodeText = dynamic_cast<const xmlpp::TextNode *>(node);
253 
254  if (nodeText && nodeText->is_white_space()) //Let's ignore the indenting - you don't always want to do this.
255  return;
256 
257  if (nodeText) {
258  textFromBodyFile << nodeText->get_content() << std::endl;
259  }
260  if (!nodeContent) {
261  //Recurse through child nodes:
262  xmlpp::Node::NodeList list = node->get_children();
263  for (xmlpp::Node::NodeList::iterator iter = list.begin(); iter != list.end(); ++iter) {
264  printNodeAndChildren(*iter, textFromBodyFile); //recursive
265  }
266  }
267 }
276 int HTTPDownloader::parseHtmlAndSave(const std::string &htmlText, const std::string &nodeOfHtmlTree,
277  std::string &output, std::set<std::string> &uniqueAttributes) {
278  //parse htmlText and save to file only the text from given nodeOfHtmlTree
279  xmlpp::DomParser parser;
280 
281  parser.parse_memory(htmlText); //parse html code from string
282 
283  if (parser) {
284  //Walk the tree
285  const xmlpp::Node *pNode = parser.get_document()->get_root_node();
286  xmlpp::NodeSet result = pNode->find(nodeOfHtmlTree); //find node given in function parameter
287  std::stringstream ss;
288  for (auto i : result) //for every result print text from node to file
289  {
290  getNodeAndChildren(i, ss, 0, uniqueAttributes);
291  }
292  for (auto i : uniqueAttributes) {
293  output += i;
294  output += '\n';
295  }
296 
297  std::cout << "Ilosc atrybutow:" << uniqueAttributes.size() << std::endl;
298  }
299  return uniqueAttributes.size();
300 }
301 void print_indentation(unsigned int indentation) {
302  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < indentation; ++i)
303  std::cout << " ";
304 }
